page.title: 02CLUTTON -What's in a name?
page.content: The name{CLUTTON}comes from Clude meaning stream and don meaning hill. The village is built in a valley by a stream. We would like to take you on a walk around{CLUTTON}. Go out of the school, turn right past Broomhill Lane and up Cook's Hill.The full name is Jossie Cook's Hill. Joseph Cook was a steward to the Earl of Warwick. Go up to the Upper Bristol Road where you can see the Warwick Arms on the right.The pub takes its name from the Earl of Warwick who owned much of the land in {CLUTTON}at one time.Go back down into the valley along the path through the Avenue leading to the Church.Walk along Venus Lane past the King's Oak a tree planted in 1902,into Station Road. On the right is Maynard Terrace built in 1900 to provide homes for the miners.Viscount Maynard owned the land
